channel.title: Function Between(First, Last: Integer): Boolean;

item.title: Function Between(First, Last: Integer): Boolean;
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:2, topic:188016”]I could rewrite half of the script engine to make that compile… or… you could not be lazy and write
if ((x > (x - 5)) and (x < (x + 5))) then Exit;

;)[/quote]
Sorry, forgot about that way.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 25, 2008, 01:21:23 AM[/size][hr][quote=“IP-Drowner”][quote author=Freddy1990 link=topic=250668.msg2118286#msg2118286 date=1205877289]
I could rewrite half of the script engine to make that compile… or… you could not be lazy and write
if ((x > (x - 5)) and (x < (x + 5))) then Exit;


[/quote]
Sorry, forgot about that way.[/quote][quote=“IP-Drowner”][quote author=Freddy1990 link=topic=250668.msg2118286#msg2118286 date=1205877289]
I could rewrite half of the script engine to make that compile… or… you could not be lazy and write
if ((x > (x - 5)) and (x < (x + 5))) then Exit;


[/quote]
Sorry, forgot about that way.[/quote]
Actually now by looking at that and using it, it is not what i meant. I mean it will return True if XX equals a numeral that is between the numbers x-5 and x+5.

item.title: Function Between(First, Last: Integer): Boolean;
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

Now i think you might understand from my title but i’ll explain further. Is it possible for an in-built function that returns a boolean.

I want it to be used like this:if(x is Between(x-5, x+5)) then Exit;

Say X has a value of 100 and the mouse is at the x axis position of 90. And the mouse moves right 5 spaces, then that above statement will return true then that procedure or function will exit. Example: repeat x:=100; i:=i+1; MoveMouse(i, 0); Until(i is Between(x-5, x+5));

If you don’t understand i will try to explain further in the next reply.

Read full topic
